incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are aware that the 3rd party service Github is currently down. We are currently waiting for a resolution. Impacted are Builds using the Build Cache which will be slower as the Build Cache CLI cannot be downloaded. Builds downloading artifacts from Github (including for example Android builds) may also fail

We are aware of elevated errors on the workflow editor.

If you're experiencing issues with your Apple ID connection, please remove the account and reconnect using your credentials and make sure you use the latest version of the following steps: xcode-archive , export-xcarchive, xcode-build-for-test, manage-ios-code-signing.
Apple has eliminated support for an undocumented API that the community relied on heavily, causing issues with the Apple Dev Portal API. Our team is working on a resolution with the highest priority.
Identified - We're experiencing errors with the Apple Dev Portal API. While we await Apple's acknowledgment and fix, we are actively exploring potential workarounds.

incidents.name: Some customers may experience issues with subscribing to our "Hobby"plan

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Some customers have reported experiencing issues subscribing to our "Hobby" plan. Our Website team is currently looking into this. We will send updates as soon as possible and we apologize for the inconvenience this may cause.

Invocations done in the timeframe 8:40 CET -> 11:00 CET were unfortunately not saved, so for these builds, customers won't see their invocation details, but for newer builds everything is working good again, and the issue is resolved.

Some users can experience that Gradle analytics has stopped working for them, they can see "No cache usage" on their gradle / android builds.

Our engineers are currently looking into this.

incidents.name: Elevated queue times on our Xcode stacks/M1 Max machines

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are currently experiencing queues on our Xcode stacks. We take the availability of build machines for all users very seriously and understand how crucial this is to our customer's ability to deliver. Please know that our Infra team is working hard to resolve this issue. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

incident_updates.body: We encountered elevated latency issues between our Mac environment and the Central control plane. Fortunately, we had preemptively prepared for such scenarios with necessary updates already being tested in our staging environment and other clusters. Following the deployment of these changes to the Mac environment, the issue has been successfully resolved. We do not expect this issue to arise again and have not observed any serious impact on customer builds.
incident_updates.custom_tweet: We published a postmortem on our May 9th incident: https://stspg.io/47sjgcmn3zpp
